answers.answer: I was negative with my first two pregnancies and am now positive.
Negative with first and positive with pregnancy.  Im due in 20 days hoping things go well.

Strep B is a naturally occurring bacteria that comes and goes. Nobody really knows what causes it, but about 30% of women are carriers. As long as its tested for before you give birth, they'll just give you antibiotics during delivery so the baby doesn't get sick. Nothing to worry about, really.
I had with first not second and now I got it with my third. You just have to have iv while giving birth.

I've seen it present in males too. It can have symptoms or not. Mine didn't but I had it so many years it didn't present until Reactive Arthritis has destroyed my body and had a heart attack, diabetes, high cholesterol,gallstones and sludge.I had a bad tooth for so long and that's where the bacteria was coming from and setting up in my stomach and bloodstream.So destructive when left untreated. Doctors don't know a lot about arthritis that is RF Negative (doesn't show up in blood work)I hate I always seemed to find doctors that tell me why. I'm lucky I found one who tells me how.I was labeled as a pull seeker for over a decade because my blood work didn't show my silent symptoms
